page.title: 11GLOUCESTER CATHEDRAL
page.content: THE ABBEY CHURCH WAS STARTED IN 1089 A.D. AND FINISHED IN 1242 A.D. IT IS MOSTLY BUILT FROM COTSWOLD STONE, BUT THE BOTTOM COURSES ARE MADE FROM HARDER STONE TO SUPPORT IT. THIS HARDER STONE CAME FROM MINCHINHAMPTON THE TOWER IS 225 FT. HIGH. THE TWO TYPES OF ARCHITECTURE USED ARE PERPENDICULAR AND NORMAN. THE CATHEDRAL CLOISTERS ARE SITUATED ON THE NORTHERN SIDE WHICH IS UNUSUAL BECAUSE IT WAS USUALLY ON THE SOUTHERN SIDE, WHICH WAS NEAREST A BUSY ROAD AND NOT SUITABLE FOR MONKS AT PRAYER. THE CATHEDRAL IS ALSO THE BURIAL PLACE OF EDWARD 2ND WHO WAS MURDERED AT BERKELEY CASTLE IN 1327. SPRING WATER WAS BROUGHT BY CONDUIT FROM ROBINSWOOD HILL GIVING A CONSTANT SUPPLY OF CLEAN WATER. THE MONASTERY WAS DISSOLVED BY HENRY 8TH.
